intro: Adelobotrys atlanticus, commonly known as the Atlantic adelobotrys, is a rare flowering plant native to the coastal regions of the eastern United States. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist, sandy soils along the Atlantic coast. The plant produces small, white, fragrant flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture. It is adapted to salt spray and is considered an indicator species for coastal ecosystems.
